section.title: Samples
section.para: This document explains the samples that are bundled along with &jax-ws.product.name;.

The samples included with &jax-ws.product.name.short; that is distributed on Java.net documents how to use &jax-ws.product.name.short; in a non-Java EE 5 servlet container using a proprietary deployment descriptor sun-jaxws.xml and servlet com.sun.xml.ws.transport.http.servlet.WSServlet. This means that you can these &jax-ws.product.name.short; applications in any servlet container that has been enabled with &jax-ws.product.name.short;. Applications that use the proprietary DD and servlet will run in a &jax-ws.product.name.short; enabled Java EE 5 servlet container, but they will be non-portable. If you wish to use these &jax-ws.product.name.short; samples in a Java EE container in a Java EE portable manner you need to modify them to use the standard Java EE 5 deployment descriptor; please refer to the Java EE 5 or Glassfish documentation/samples.
All these samples are tested to run on Glassfish V2.1 build and on Apache Tomcat 5.x.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: Here is the list of prerequisites that needs to be met before any of the samples can be invoked:

listitem.para: Download Java 2 Standard Edition 5.0 Update 2 or later ( J2SE 5.0). Set JAVA_HOME to the J2SE 5.0 installation directory.
Set &jax-ws.home; to the JAX-WS installation directory.

Make sure that your container is configured for port 8080 as samples are hardcoded with this port info. Otherwise, you need to change samples to use the correct port by replacing '8080" with your port in all the files included in the sample.

section.title: Running the sample
section.para: Each sample has a readme.txt in its directory that details the instructions specific to the sample. Each sample can be built, deployed and invoked using the ANT_HOME/bin/ant and build.xml ant script in the root directory of the sample. Each ant script supports the following set of targets:

entry.para: Builds and deploy the service endpoint WAR on Glassfish v2 installation referenced by $AS_HOME
Builds and deploy the service endpoint WAR on Tomcat installation referenced by $CATALINA_HOME
Builds the client
Runs the client

section.para: Some samples (e.g. fromjava, supplychain) can be built, deployed using javax.xml.ws.Endpoint API. These samples support extra targets:

entry.para: Builds and deploys the Endpoint API based service endpoint (doesn't terminate until server-j2se-stop is called)

row.entry: Stops the Endpoint API based service endpoint (need to run from a different window)

section.para: It is essential for the service endpoint to be deployed on Application Server before clients can be built because clients use the WSDL exposed from the service endpoint deployed in the Application Server. So please make sure that your Application Server is either running before the server target is invoked or run it after the server target is invoked. You will have to wait a few minutes for the Application Server to deploy the service endpoint correctly before building the client.
